attributes.action: Make the BCAP allow Compassion in World Farming(CIWF)to advertise on TV
attributes.additional_details:
Currently the BCAP have stopped them advertising of TV under the following points
 a)         Wholly or mainly ‘political’ in nature or
b)         Seeking to influence public opinion on a matter that, in the united kingdom, is a matter of public controversy

Please see the CIWF website for more details of the work they do and be the voice of the millions of farm animals that are forced to live in unacceptable conditions.
attributes.background:
CIWF is a charity that promotes the ethical raising of livestock.
The well-being of farm animals has to be addressed and standards improved to stop unethical and cruel treatment.CIWF must be able to advertise on TV more people can be made aware of their work and able to make a difference.

rejection.details: The BCAP is an industry committee and is independent of the Government and Parliament.
